author: ram
text: Your patient knows youre a hard-working professional, so he doesn’t expect you to be at his beck-and-call 24/7. If he has a true medical need at 2 a.m., he’ll accept the on-call provider without complaint. But he doesn’t like talking to an answering service and providing even minimal information about his need to someone he assumes is a customer service person at a contracted, non-medical company.
